vine.window

Interface Window

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GLFWWindow

    public interface Window
    A window, represents a system window, that exists within a display and is used, to display a application.
    Author:
    Steffen

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Window.CloseCallback
      Callback, used to react to a close request on the window.
      static interface  Window.FramebufferSizeCallback
      Callback, used to react to a change of the framebuffer size.
      static interface  Window.PositionCallback
      Callback, used to react to window position change.
      static interface  Window.SizeCallback
      Callback, used to react to a window size change.

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Returns:
        The current width of the window.

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns:
        The current height of the window.

      • getPosX

        int getPosX()
        Returns:
        The current x position of the window on the display.

      • getPosY

        int getPosY()
        Returns:
        The current y position of the window on the display.

      • getFramebufferWidth

        int getFramebufferWidth()
        Returns:
        The current frambuffer width;

      • getFramebufferHeight

        int getFramebufferHeight()
        Returns:
        The current framebuffer height;

      • setWindowSize

        void setWindowSize(int width,
                   int height)
        Parameters:
        width - The new width the window changed to.
        height - The new height the window changed to.

      • setWindowPosition

        void setWindowPosition(int xPos,
                       int yPos)
        Parameters:
        xPos - The new x position of the window on the display
        yPos - The new y position of the window on the display

        void setTitle(String title)

      • init

        void init(Display display)
   throws WindowCreationException
        Parameters:
        display - The physical display that the window is showed on.
        Throws:
        WindowCreationException - Signals, that the window could not be created.

      • isResizeable

        boolean isResizeable()
        Returns:
        True, if the window is resizeable by the user.

      • isVisible

        boolean isVisible()
        Returns:
        True, if the window is visible to the user.

      • isFocused

        boolean isFocused()
        Returns:
        True, if the window has user focus.

      • isDecorated

        boolean isDecorated()
        Returns:
        True, if the window is decorated.

      • isIconified

        boolean isIconified()
        Returns:
        True, if the window is currently iconified.

      • requestedClose

        boolean requestedClose()
        Returns:
        True, if the user want to close the window.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes (destroys) the window.

      • hide

        void hide()
        Hides the window from the user.

      • show

        void show()
        Shows the window to the user.

      • getContext

        long getContext()
        Returns:
        The context of the window, that is used to identify the window in the game.

        String getTitle()
